qas.question: How many counties did New York originally have?
Parts of which towns became part of the Bronx?
When was the town of Kingsbridge created?

context: The territory now contained within Bronx County was originally part of Westchester County, one of the <a0_0>12<a0_0/> original counties of the English Province of New York. The present Bronx County was contained in the town of Westchester and parts of the towns of <a1_0>Yonkers, Eastchester, and Pelham<a1_0/>. In <a2_0>1846<a2_0/>, a new town, West Farms, was created by division of Westchester; in turn, in <a3_0>1855<a3_0/>, the town of Morrisania was created from West Farms. In <a4_0>1873<a4_0/>, the town of Kingsbridge (roughly corresponding to the modern Bronx neighborhoods of Kingsbridge, Riverdale, and Woodlawn) was established within the former borders of Yonkers.
